title: badmintonInfo website
overview: badmintonInfo is a dynamic website that showcases badminton gear and professional players that use them. The site utilized XAMPP for local development environment, PHP for server-side scripting, and MySQL for database management. UI wise, this was the first time I designed a site using Bootstrap for clean, easy, and reusable code.

title: Portfolio websites
description: my old static and current react website
overview: This website is supposed to be the culmination of everything I've learned so far, I made it using React (Vite) and Bootstrap. This website is a remake and upgrade of my old website that I made during reading break in an effort to learn React. My old website can be acessed through https://sleepsim.github.io/portfolio-old/

title: Simple Recipe Website
overview: A simple recipe website powered by PHP that stores all info in a text file, Users are able to input various details like ingredients, prep time, cooking time, etc. All recipes are loaded and shown on the front page

title: SFU Quizlet
overview: SFU Quizlet was a final project for my Android Development class, I was in charge of creating and designing the front page as well as the course list. The app was written in Kotlin, and firebase was used for our database that contained all the courses, questions/answers, as well as user data.

title: Movie Dataset Visualization
overview: An Observable notebook using JavaScript, VegaLite and D3 to analyze and clean two datasets, each containing ~2000 movies. Using JS, I  processed and cleaned the datasets to ensure accuracy and consistency. Subsequently, I employed VegaLite, D3 to visualize and present the insights derived from the cleaned datasets.

title: YouTube shorts converter
description: converts shorts to full video player
overview: Sometime around last year, YouTube introduced YouTube Shorts, a vertical video format thatâ€™s supposed to emulate popular video sites like Tik-Tok and Instagram Reels. The problem was that it was turning some short videos that were not meant to be shorts into YT Shorts. YT shorts gives you no control over playback, sound is only a toggle, and the video is fit into a vertical frame which was super annoying so I made this extension which I still use today

title: Garden Exchange App Concept
overview: For the final project of my interface design class, we were tasked with creating a feasible app concept. My group came up with Garden exchange, it is a platform that enables gardeners to connect, share, and exchange their homegrown produce, flowers, plants, and other garden-related items.

title: Kijiji Pickup - Feature Design Concept
description: A concept of a possible feature for the Kijiji mobile app
overview: A mockup concept for a possible feature for the kijiji app. The feature allows users to send offers and directly pay for the item if the seller accepts the offer. The seller and buyer can then dropoff/pickup items at select pickup locations (like storage facilities). The main aim of the feature is to make buying and selling easier, sellers can drop off the item at the storage facility and the buyer can pickup items at their own convenience.
